title: With Quarkus 3, hibernate parameter padding changed to 16 for queries on primary keys
body:
### Describe the bug

Quarkus 3 changed JPA queries for primary keys to IN statements with a parameter padding of 16 instead of 1.
Shouldn't the parameter padding be exponential and start with 1 instead of 16?
Maybe this is related to an update of the hibernate library?

**Examples**
_Quarkus 2.6.18.Final_
`	select f1_0.id from foo_bar f1_0 where f1_0.id=?`
_Quarkus 3.2.0.Final_
`	select f1_0.id from foo_bar f1_0 where f1_0.id in (?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?,?)`

_Quarkus 2.6.18.Final_
`	select f1_0.key1, f1_0.key2 from foo_bar2 f1_0 where ( f1_0.key1,f1_0.key2 ) in((?,?))`
_Quarkus 3.2.0.Final_
`	select f1_0.key1, f1_0.key2 from foo_bar2 f1_0 where f1_0.key1,f1_0.key2 ) in ((?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?),(?,?))`

Also the values for the padding are wrong, since all values after the first are filled with `null` and that brings the query optimiser of my MySQL database to the idea of completely ignoring the primary key as a possible key, leading to a query timeout.

I've supplied an example project for Quarkus 3.2.0.Final with logging of the query and the parameter values at startup: https://github.com/McIntozh/quarkus3-test

### Expected behavior

Parameter padding for queries on primary keys should either be 1 or the values should all be filled identic

### Actual behavior

Parameter padding is 16, only the first parameter is filled all others are `null`

### How to Reproduce?

Reproducer: https://github.com/McIntozh/quarkus3-test

Run with `mvn quarkus:dev` an observe the queries in the console log
